Final Countdown

Written by: Ryan Hayden on Jun 15, 2016

Sitesfor.church will be launching Monday, June 25!

Dear prospective client, It’s been a wild couple of weeks, and we’ve cleared most of the technical hurdles that were keeping us from launching sitesfor.church. I’m excited to say that we are getting close and have decided to set a deadline for June 25 and work like mad to get everything ready by then.

Here is what that means for you:

Documentation

I’ve written a basic how-to guide for using the site. I’m planning on writing much more and adding many more videos. But this guide which I’m calling Sitesfor.church 101 should be a huge start. It includes three videos explaining how to update the site.

Here is that link again.

Site-Reps

We now have four site-reps. These guys (all of them preachers) will be paid to help you set up the site and to be your contact person should you need help. Site reps are, far and away, the most exciting thing we are doing at sitesfor.church and I’m hoping this will be a big opportunity for them. If you’ve already signed up to be one of our “guinea pigs” then, we’ll let you know soon who your assigned site-rep is going to be.

Three Templates:

We are going to be launching with three custom templates for churches as well as a template for pastors or evangelists who want their own blog with sermons. More church templates (from different designers) and missionary templates are in the works.

Check out the templates below:

California Template

New England Template

Virginia Template

Personal Template

Payment

When we launch on June 25th, we will ask all of our prospective clients - even the ones we have been working with, to fill out the form on our signup page. As a part of the signup options they’ll be directed to PayPal where they can choose to pay for Sitesfor.church either monthly or annually.

We are going to try to keep you posted. Thank you so much for your patience through all of this.
